Subsistence Impacts on Occipital Biomechanics
    Occipital bone morphology across hunter-gatherer, horticultural, and agricultural skeletal collections reveals systematic variation in biomechanical loading by subsistence type and sex.

    Global R&D Leadership Forecasting and Policy Modelling

    Women in Governance & Women's Empowerment

title: Kara C. Hoover
text:
I’m a biological anthropologist and data scientist who bridges academic research, policy analysis, and applied analytics. My work spans human biological variation and adaptation – from biomechanics and genetic epidemiology to olfactory evolution and sensory inequities – alongside data-driven policy research in international science strategy, global R&D trends, and social equity. I specialize in translating complex data into actionable intelligence through advanced analytics (NLP, machine learning, network analysis), interactive visualizations, and reproducible workflows in R, Python, and SQL.
ORCID | Google Scholar | GitHub

title: Kara C. Hoover
text:
Research Areas
Human Biological Variation & Adaptation Bioarchaeology, biomechanics, developmental stress, skeletal morphology, sexual dimorphism, population health across prehistory and the colonial era.
Olfactory Science & Genetics Odorant receptor variation, olfactory ecology, field and lab methods, sensory inequities, and the evolutionary biology of smell in humans and other primates.
Policy & International Science Global R&D trends, science strategy, democracy and governance, women’s empowerment, forecasting and policy modelling using large comparative datasets.
Climate, Health & Adaptation Extreme weather impacts, health care access and life expectancy, conservation and conflict, geospatial analysis of human-environment interaction.
